contribution: Known for his work on major comedy films.

name: Christophe Beck
contribution: Emmy-winning composer known for his work on 'Frozen' and the 'Ant-Man' films.

name: Mark Mothersbaugh
contribution: Co-founder of the band Devo and a prolific, quirky composer for film and television.

name: Atli Örvarsson
contribution: Known for his work on television series and collaborations with Hans Zimmer.

name: Henry Jackman
contribution: Known for his scores for superhero films and animated features.

name: Heitor Pereira
contribution: Former member of Simply Red, known for his scores for animated films, especially the 'Despicable Me' series.

name: John Debney
contribution: Versatile and prolific composer for film and television across many genres.

name: Christopher Young
contribution: Known for his work in the horror and thriller genres.

name: Marco Beltrami
contribution: Known for his work on horror films and action movies.

name: Brian Tyler
contribution: Prolific composer for major action films and video games.

name: Tyler Bates
contribution: Known for his rock-infused scores and collaborations with Zack Snyder and James Gunn.

name: David Buckley
contribution: Known for his work on television series and video games.

name: Harry Escott
contribution: Known for his atmospheric and emotionally intense scores.

name: Jed Kurzel
contribution: Known for his intense and often unsettling scores for dramatic films.

name: Daniel Hart
contribution: Known for his collaboration with director David Lowery.

name: Rob Simonsen
contribution: Known for his work on independent films and major studio pictures.

name: Matthew Margeson
contribution: Known for his work on action and comedy films, often collaborating with Henry Jackman.
works: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children

name: Joseph Trapanese
contribution: Known for his electronic and orchestral scores, and collaborations with Daft Punk and M83.

name: Guillaume Roussel
contribution: Known for his work on French and international films.
works: The Man with the Iron Heart

name: Pinar Toprak
contribution: Known for being the first woman to score a major superhero film.

name: Gordy Haab
contribution: Known for his epic orchestral scores for 'Star Wars' video games.

name: Stephen Barton
contribution: Known for his work on major video game franchises.

name: Frederik Wiedmann
contribution: Emmy-winning composer known for his work on animated series.

name: Kevin Kiner
contribution: Known for his extensive work on the 'Star Wars' animated series.
works: Star Wars: The Clone Wars (TV series)

name: Ryan Shore
contribution: Grammy-nominated composer known for his work on comedies and animated films.
works: Star Wars: Forces of Destiny (TV series)

name: Austin Wintory
contribution: Grammy-nominated composer, the first to be nominated for a video game score.

name: Jessica Curry
contribution: BAFTA-winning composer known for her emotionally rich and atmospheric game scores.

name: Olivier Deriviere
contribution: Known for his innovative and interactive scores for video games.

name: Winifred Phillips
contribution: Award-winning composer for video games, known for her work on the 'LittleBigPlanet' series.

name: Lena Raine
contribution: Known for her acclaimed electronic scores for independent video games.

name: Darren Korb
contribution: Known for his genre-blending scores for the games by Supergiant Games.

name: Koji Kondo
contribution: Legendary video game composer, created some of the most iconic and recognizable themes in gaming history for Nintendo.

name: Nobuo Uematsu
contribution: Renowned for his extensive work on the 'Final Fantasy' video game series.

name: Yoko Shimomura
contribution: One of the most prominent female video game composers, known for her work on 'Kingdom Hearts' and 'Street Fighter II'.

name: Keiichi Okabe
contribution: Known for his critically acclaimed and emotionally resonant scores for the 'Nier' series.

name: Yasunori Mitsuda
contribution: Acclaimed composer for video games, known for his Celtic-influenced and epic scores.

name: Duke Ellington
contribution: One of the most important figures in jazz, a masterful composer, pianist, and bandleader whose orchestra was a laboratory for his innovative sounds.
works: It Don't Mean a Thing (If it Ain't Got That Swing)

name: Thelonious Monk
contribution: A unique pianist and composer who was a key architect of bebop, known for his dissonant harmonies and angular melodic twists.

name: Charles Mingus
contribution: Virtuosic bassist, composer, and bandleader, known for his ambitious works that blended hard bop with gospel, blues, and classical music.
works: Better Git It in Your Soul

name: Mary Lou Williams
contribution: A highly influential pianist and composer who shaped the sound of jazz through the swing, bebop, and avant-garde eras.

name: Wayne Shorter
contribution: A legendary saxophonist and composer, pivotal in the development of post-bop jazz with Art Blakey, Miles Davis, and Weather Report.

name: Herbie Hancock
contribution: Pioneering jazz pianist and composer who has explored post-bop, fusion, and electronic music, constantly innovating.

name: Chick Corea
contribution: A virtuoso pianist and composer at the forefront of jazz fusion with his band Return to Forever.

name: John Coltrane
contribution: A revolutionary saxophonist and composer whose work in modal and free jazz had a profound impact on music.

name: Miles Davis
contribution: One of the most influential and acclaimed figures in the history of jazz, a trumpeter, bandleader, and composer who was central to multiple major developments.

name: Bill Evans
contribution: A highly influential jazz pianist known for his introspective and lyrical style, and his use of impressionistic harmony.

name: Jelly Roll Morton
contribution: A pivotal figure in early jazz, a pianist and composer who claimed to have invented the genre.

name: Scott Joplin
contribution: The 'King of Ragtime', known for his classic piano rags and his ambitious opera 'Treemonisha'.

name: William Walton
contribution: A leading British composer known for his dramatic orchestral works, concertos, and film scores.

name: Michael Tippett
contribution: An English composer whose work often explored pacifist and humanist themes, known for his oratorio 'A Child of Our Time'.
works: Fantasia Concertante on a Theme of Corelli

name: Tōru Takemitsu
contribution: The foremost Japanese composer of the 20th century, known for his subtle and evocative works that blend Western and Eastern aesthetics.
works: From me flows what you call Time

name: John Tavener
contribution: A leading composer of spiritual minimalist music, deeply influenced by the Orthodox Christian faith.

name: Thomas Adès
contribution: One of the most acclaimed contemporary composers, known for his brilliant and complex operas and orchestral works.

name: George Benjamin
contribution: A leading contemporary composer, particularly acclaimed for his meticulously crafted and dramatically potent operas.

name: Harrison Birtwistle
contribution: A major figure in British modernism, known for his uncompromisingly complex and ritualistic works.

name: Peter Maxwell Davies
contribution: A leading post-war British composer and former Master of the Queen's Music, known for his dramatic and often theatrical works.
works: Eight Songs for a Mad King

name: Elliott Carter
contribution: A titan of American modernism, known for his complex and rhythmically intricate works, composing prolifically into his 100s.

name: Morton Feldman
contribution: A pioneer of indeterminate music, known for his exceptionally quiet, sparse, and often very long compositions.

name: Iannis Xenakis
contribution: An architect and composer who pioneered stochastic music, using mathematical probability systems to create powerful, visceral sound masses.

name: Edgard Varèse
contribution: A visionary composer who emphasized timbre and rhythm, conceiving of music as 'organized sound' and pioneering electronic music.

name: Conlon Nancarrow
contribution: Known for his complex and rhythmically intricate studies for player piano, exploring tempos and textures impossible for human hands.

name: Harry Partch
contribution: An iconoclastic American composer who created his own system of microtonal tuning (43-tone scale) and built custom instruments to play his music.

name: Moondog
contribution: A blind street musician and composer in New York, known as 'the Viking of 6th Avenue', who created complex, rhythmic, and often beautiful music.

name: Pauline Oliveros
contribution: A central figure in post-war electronic music, known for her concept of 'Deep Listening' and her work with improvisation and meditation.

name: Terry Jennings
contribution: An early minimalist composer associated with La Monte Young, known for his quiet and contemplative pieces.

name: Meredith Monk
contribution: A composer, singer, and director known for her unique and highly extended vocal techniques.

name: Frederic Rzewski
contribution: A virtuoso pianist and composer known for his politically charged and technically demanding works, especially 'The People United Will Never Be Defeated!'.
works: The People United Will Never Be Defeated!

name: Galina Ustvolskaya
contribution: A reclusive and intensely spiritual Russian composer, known for her raw, powerful, and uncompromisingly dissonant music.

name: Valentin Silvestrov
contribution: A leading Ukrainian composer, known for his 'meta-music' style which creates nostalgic and atmospheric echoes of past musical eras.

name: Giya Kancheli
contribution: A leading Georgian composer known for his deeply spiritual and often static music, marked by stark contrasts between silence and powerful outbursts.

name: Alfredo Casella
contribution: An influential Italian composer, conductor, and pianist who was a key figure in the generation that followed Puccini.

name: Ferruccio Busoni
contribution: A visionary pianist, composer, and theorist who championed a 'New Classicality' and wrote the monumental Piano Concerto.

name: Luigi Nono
contribution: A leading figure of the post-war avant-garde, known for his politically charged works and pioneering use of electronics.

name: Giacinto Scelsi
contribution: An eccentric and mystical composer known for his microtonal works that focus on single pitches, exploring their inner life.
works: Quattro Pezzi su una nota sola
